New Records: Cleveland's five-run blitz in the first inning tied the MLB record for runs scored to start a postseason game before recording an out
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas' home run off Reese Olson was the decisive blow in the game
Tanner Bibee's 13 sinkers thrown in the game, including multiple instances where it induced weak contact
Cade Smith's postseason debut and three strikeouts in the game
Pre-Game Insights: Manager AJ Hinch explained his decision to go to Reese Olson in the specific fire with runners on the corners and nobody out
Lane Thomas' track record of punishing left-handed pitching,.880 career OPS against southpaws
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised the team's preparation and competitive nature in simulated games during the layoff
Tanner Bibee mentioned that he decided to bring back the sinker, which he used to throw in college, to give him another weapon to induce weak contact
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a packed home crowd of 33,548 eager to explode before the Guardians even picked up a bat
The 7-0 victory for Cleveland was as commanding and comfortable a win as you'll see this time of year
The stage will be set for Tarik Skubal to play hero again and try to recapture some good vibes for a Tigers team that needs a stronger collective effort
